personality.title: Khoth
personality.look: The enormous creature looks amused and intrigued by you. Someone proving their worth to speak with them must be a novel experience. The beast towers over you. As it looks you over, it idly scratches the floor with a broadsword sized claw.
personality.name: "I am Khoth." Small puffs of flame come out of its mouth and nose as it speaks.
personality.job: "My purpose? Why, I am a dragon, mightiest of creatures. I learn, and I increase my power at will. And, at times, I demand tribute."

node.text: "I, like my siblings, am master of whatever domain I choose. The only creatures that challenge dragons are humans, and rarely even them."
"The oldest of us. Slain by humans."
"Furious and uncontrolled. Slain by humans. Humans are a pesky breed. Never should be trusted."
"She has just had a brood of hatchlings. One can only hope they will carry our line to every corner of the world."
"The strongest of us all, if not the smartest. I have not seen her for some time, but I know she plans a powerful reckoning against you humans for the inconvenience you have caused us."

"Humans. Small, treacherous, numerous. The humans of the Empire stole my books once, and then swarmed me when they invaded Exile. I have no love for humans. I only let you see me because I wish to take your tribute."
He smiles. "Of course, sometimes you humans are harried by other races, such as the Vahnatai, or the sliths. I enjoy this."

"Other dragons lust for gold, and swords, and other inert things. I seek tomes, and spells, and other forms of knowledge. Living wealth! As my siblings grew old and feeble, I grew stronger. As my body goes, my strength increases. It is a wondrous thing."
"Pfaugh!" he roars. The fire from his mouth gets uncomfortably close to you. "They drove dragons from the surface! They stole from us and harassed us and even enslaved me for a time. Me!"
"I will never pass up on a chance to harm the Empire. Never."
"The slithzerikai are lizard kin, so I feel some affinity for them. I have given them some knowledge for use in the battle against Exile. It amuses me to do so."
"A learned people. I respect them for that. They slew many of the humans in the Empire. I respect them even more for that."

"You wish to leave my fortress to the north. I don't wish to let you. So. There are many treasures in the Za-Khazi run, treasures which I have coveted for some time. Make one of these treasures a payment to me, and I will let you pass."
Khoth sniffs the air. "We dragons can smell treasure, and I can tell you have nothing that would be of use to me. Leave, and return only when you have wealth."
